vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
πτωχός, ή, όν,
also ός, όν [Refs 5th c.BC+]:— beggar, [Refs 8th c.BC+] beggar-woman, [NT+5th c.BC+]
__2 metaphorically, οἱ π. τῷ πνεύματι [NT]
__II as adjective, beggarly, πτωχῷ διαίτῃ [NT+5th c.BC+]: with genitive, beggared of, poor in, [πηγὴ] π. νυμφῶν [Refs 1st c.AD+]
__II.2 comparative πτωχότερος [Refs 4th c.BC+]; proverbial, π. κίγκλου 'as poor as a church mouse', [Refs 5th c.BC+]: superlative πτωχότατος [Refs 6th c.AD+]
__II.3 adverb -χῶς poorly, scantily, ἠροτρία π. μέν, ἀλλ᾽ ἀναγκαίως [Refs 2nd c.AD+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: poor; (n.) poor, beggar, a person of few resources, culturally considered oppressed, despised, and miserable. "The poor in spirit" are not lacking in spirit, but have the positive moral quality of humility, realizing they have nothing to offer God but are in need of his free gifts
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
poor; (n.) poor, beggar, a person of few resources, culturally considered oppressed, despised, and miserable. "The poor in spirit" are not lacking in spirit, but have the positive moral quality of humility, realizing they have nothing to offer God but are in need of his free gifts
reduced to beggary, mendicant; poor, indigent, Mt. 19:21; 26:9, 11; metaphorically spiritually poor, Rev. 3:17; by implication a person of low condition, Mt. 11:4; Lk. 4:18; 7:22; metaphorically beggarly, sorry, Gal. 4:9; metaphorically lowly, Mt. 5:3; Lk. 6:20
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition:
1) 仰仗別人養生的,貧窮的
2) (極需屬天資源)貧窮的
3) 缺乏屬靈價值的 (太 5:3; 啟 3:17)
4) 低劣,堪憐的 (林前 15:10; 加 4:9))
vocabInfos._zh_Definition:
1) 仰仗别人养生的,贫穷的
2) (极需属天资源)贫穷的
3) 缺乏属灵价值的(太5:3; 启3:17)
4)低劣,堪怜的(林前15:10; 加4:9))
